title: Bug 5340 - Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect
OB: When adding an exception breakpoint, if the cancel button is clicked in the progress dialog, the dialog closes immediately and the exception is still added to the list. The cancellation request is ignored. This behavior should be changed so that either the cancellation request is honored, or the cancel button is disabled in the progress dialog.
EB: When cancelling the addition of an exception breakpoint, either the cancellation request should be honored (by not adding the exception to the list), or the cancel button in the progress dialog should be disabled.
SR:
To reproduce:
1) Go to the breakpoints pane in the debug perspective.
2) Click the J! button to add an exception breakpoint.
3) In the progress dialog, click cancel.
